intro: Gunisanthus pilosula, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Gunisanthus pilosula is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been the subject of botanical study due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
